snippet: Some consumers, weary of microscopic interest rates, are tempted by potentially riskier options beyond the world of federally insured savings.
abstract: Tara Siegel Bernard Your Money column enumerates the risks of putting emergency savings into short-term bonds, stock funds or other investments outside the world of federally insured savings; suggests that such investments should be regarded skeptically, and put into the context of the investor's long-term goals.
lead_paragraph: Some consumers, weary of microscopic interest rates, are tempted by potentially riskier options beyond the world of federally insured savings.

headline.seo: How to Get Better Interest Rates for Saving Money
headline.main: Options for Savers Seeking Better Rates
headline.print_headline: Options For Savers Seeking Better Rates
